General course objectives:
General course objectives
To provide competences in experimental physics in Health Technology
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
plan and carry out a sequence of experiments with a tight time schedule.
work with an open problem within health technology.
work in the lab with safety in focus.
participate constructively in a research team.
use equipment and methods in a qualified manner and account for the operational principles.
account for the theoretical background / physics behind the experiments.
analyse experimental data based on relevant theory.
account for and discuss experimental sources of error.
write a brief and precise commented lab-journal that makes the results useful also to the other team members.
Content: The course is an experimental project, and the content of the project is strongly related to the ongoing research at DTU Health Tech. The project will give you the opportunity to work within different fields - such as optical sensing and imaging, ultrasound, magnetic resonance, radiation physics and dosimetry.
